alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 12 at 12:22PM PDT until April 13 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM PDT THURSDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures between 24 and 28 degrees expected. For the Frost Advisory, temperatures between 28 and 32 are expected and will result in frost formation. * WHERE...For the Freeze Warning, most of Douglas County, including the cities of Elkton, Drain, Sutherlin, Camas Valley, Tiller and Azalea. For the Frost Advisory, the cities of Roseburg, Riddle, and Canyonville. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 8 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
